title: Falakro
text:
Falakro Oros (<a href="Greek%20language">Greek</a>: Φαλακρό όρος, <a href="English%20language">English</a>: "Bald mountain"; , "Bozdag"; <a href="Turkish%20language">Turkish</a>: "Bozdağ") is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in the <a href="Drama%20%28regional%20unit%29">Drama regional unit</a>, eastern <a href="Greek%20Macedonia">Greek Macedonia</a>, northern <a href="Greece">Greece</a>. The elevation of its highest summit, <a href="Profitis%20Ilias%20%28Falakro%29">Profitis Ilias</a>, is 2232 meters above the sea level. There is a <a href="ski%20resort">ski resort</a> on the mountain.
А very small part of a low northern offshoot of Falakro extends into <a href="Bulgaria">Bulgaria</a>n territory, just south of the village of <a href="Beslen">Beslen</a> in <a href="Blagoevgrad%20Province">Blagoevgrad Province</a>. The highest point that is part of Bulgaria is the forested peak Chiplakbair (1090 metres high) on the border between the two countries.
